words.fact: Discovery is the foundation of great product management. It involves understanding customer problems, conducting user research, and identifying opportunities before building solutions.
Planning transforms insights into actionable roadmaps. This includes prioritizing features, defining success metrics, and aligning stakeholders using frameworks like MoSCoW and RICE.
Development is where ideas become reality. PMs collaborate with engineering and design teams, run sprint ceremonies, and ensure quality while balancing technical constraints with user needs.
